result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamonte E Allgood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  
*Restitution set at zero.

*04-13-17/Decision and Order - Defendant is not eligible for WSAP and CIP.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim or firearms.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

**** 1-29-2015, Judge Wagner:  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,177.20 payable to Constance L.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.****

records.addlTxt: Per remittitur dated May 15, 2018, Appeal No. 2017AP002022 CR, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on March 16, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that JAMONTE E. Allgood's appeal is dismissed as a sanction for failing to comply with the rules of appellate procedure, pursuant to Wis. Stat Rule 809.83(2) (2015-16).

records.addlTxt: per order dated November 9, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP002022 CR,  IT IS ORDERED that unless the Statement on Transcript is filed within five days of the date of this order and a copy of the statement is served on the clerk of the circuit court, the appeal in the above matter will be subject to a penalty under Rule 809.83.

Per Order Dated November 8, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP002022, IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. This order waives only the filing fees in the Court of Appeals. It is not a determination of indigency for any other ppurpose. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (18 pages) commencing 11-23-2015 received and filed.  CH

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Jamonte E Allgood not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Restitution amounts placed on the record. Defense counsel agrees with the restitution amount. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,177.20 payable to Constance L.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Jamonte E Allgood not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. State failed to produce defendant for today's proceedings. State requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 38.  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Telephone call received from ADA Nick Heitman who requested a date for a restitution hearing.  Defendant was sentenced on 11/23/15.  Matter to be scheduled within 60 days of this date.  Telephone call/message left for Attorney Kerri Cleghorn requesting a return call to schedule this hearing.  Dates of January 11, 12 and 14 were given as possible dates for hearing.
Written Explanation sheet in file is not "checked" for programs, not addressed on the sentencing entry.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant present in court in custody with Atty Kerri Cleghorn. Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 203 days served.  Court ordered 6 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- No contact with victim.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for trial on 11-2-2015.  Parties have reached a resolution.
AS to counts 1,3,4, court orders counts dismissed and read in for sentencing
AS to count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant remanded.  Sentencing adjourned to 11-23-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood not in court, defendant in custody.  Atty Cleghorn is in trial in Branch 7 and contacts the court to request a new date.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for another FPT or possible plea on 10-29-2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Motion to Admit 911 Call filed by the state.
Filed by the state:  Motion in Limine and Witness List

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Jamonte E Allgood not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State had not received all medical records yet but upon receipt will forward to defense counsel.
Case set for final pretrial on 10-20-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 11-2-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 8-25-2015.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Erik Smith.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  

Court orders case adjourned for pre-trial conference in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Doctor's report dated 6-18-2015, received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court reinstates bail.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-1-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Facsimile Copy of Doctor's Report from Mendota Mental Health Institute, Dr. Elliot Lee, dated 6-18-2015.   mld

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Jamonte E Allgood not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties reviewed the doctor report dated 6-2-2015.  Parties accept the determination of the report of Dr. Rawski, dated 6-2015, as to the competency of defendant.  Dr. Rawski recommended that the defendant be transferred for an inpatient evaluation on his competency.  Court grants request.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Competency Examination, signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report on 6-23-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld
from Dr. Robert Rawski, Wisconsin Forensic Unit, dated 6-2-2015, received and filed.  mld

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defense counsel informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Court orders defendant REMANDED and proceedings suspended.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in 4 on 6-3-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CONSTANCE L. AND DIANN L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jamonte E Allgood in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  NO PLEA ENTERED AS TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
